title: (mostly) homebrewn metal AM
abstract: A short introduction into sinter based FFF/FDM metal additive manufacturing at home (as far as it can be done)
description: After a short introduction into FFF/FDM and the basics behind sinter based FFF/FDM metal additive manufacturing this talk offers a complete overview on the procedure, the benefits and the limits compared to other well established procedures as well as the obstacles that need to be overcome when using it.

persons.biography:
Sascha 'Klapauzius' Lenze 

Certified electrical technician, first world job as a software developer (Simatic PLC/HMI) in machine building for pharmaceutical industry. Hamradio operator (Class A, callsign DH5SL, mostly short wave). More than ten years of background as a hobbyist and professional in additive manufacturing and experience in sinter based metal FFF/FDM for three years. First contact to 'information technology' on a Commodore 64 programming BASIC (~'83), ARM(2) assembler on an Acorn Archimedes (A310), Arduino priojects, on a journey exploring the new since. 
Connected to Chaostreff Dortmund (ctdo, chaos west) since 2007 and visited several conferences inclouding chaos bbq, easterheggs, mrmcd, cc camp and c3..
